solution_line_template: The price of the tea was twice the price of the cheese, so the cheese cost was {tea_cost} / {cheese_multiplier} = $<<{tea_cost}/{cheese_multiplier}={cheese_cost}>>{cheese_cost}.
The price of the butter was {butter_percentage} * {cheese_cost} = $<<{butter_percentage}*{cheese_cost}={butter_cost}>>{butter_cost}.
If the bread was {bread_divisor} times cheaper than butter, that means it cost {butter_cost} / {bread_divisor} = $<<{butter_cost}/{bread_divisor}={bread_cost}>>{bread_cost}.
That means Ursula paid for all her shopping {bread_cost} + {butter_cost} + {cheese_cost} + {tea_cost} = $<<{bread_cost}+{butter_cost}+{cheese_cost}+{tea_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
